resources.string: Don\'t pick the main storage directory or Downloads folder, create a folder only for your backups. More on this in the FAQ
The app\'s data has been actively changed while doing the backup. Try killing its process before doing backup
Couldn\'t initiate the shell handler. Either missing toybox/busybox or disabled root permission for the app.
There\'s no file manager to manage SAF. Maybe you\'ve disabled the built-in file manager. Please restore it or reenable it.
Exports or imports the list of schedules you\'ve created.
Apps\' list is still not fetched. Wait…
Failed to copy app\'s APK to the backup directory
Copied app\'s APK to the backup directory
Are you sure you want to force kill the app\?
The app can face some problems doing scheduled backups on some ROMs that adopt an aggressive battery optimizations e.g. MIUI, but even on vanilla AOSP such a problem can happen.
The app needs this permission to be able to check the stats and sizes of data and cache of your apps.
The app uses read/write permission of storage to be able to access the external storage and provide the possibility for the backup of external data/obb of other apps.
It\'s not safe to keep your data on your device not encrypted. For the safety of your data enable encryption and set a password.
The selected app(s) will be given the stop signal, and continue after the task is done. Check on your processed apps afterwards (and avoid launching them while the process is still running).

The app needs a backup location to store the backups. The app may need a few gigabytes of storage for a full backup and is querying the filesystem a lot. Please keep that in mind when choosing network based storage locations.

OAndBackupX is a fork of the infamous OAndBackup with the aim to bring it to 2020 and further. For now most of the functionality and UI of the app are rewritten and some are added. 
 The app is still in beta stages and a lot of rebasing is done often. So please read the changelog carefully with each new release. 
 All types of contribution are welcome was it translation, ideas, reporting bugs or code work. 
 
 Now on functionality of our App: 
 • It requires root and allows you to back up individual apps and their data. 
 • Both backing up and restoring individual programs one-at-a-time and batch backup and restoration of multiple programs are supported. 
 • Restoring system apps should be possible without requiring a reboot afterwards, but still we don't advise to do it. 
 • Backups can be scheduled with no limit on the number of individual schedules and there is the possibility of creating unique custom lists.
